verses.verse: Then <S%G2532><s%> the whole <S%G537><s%> body <S%G4128><s%> of them arose <S%G450><s%> and brought <S%G71><s%> Him before <S%G1909><s%> Pilate. <S%G4091><s%>

And they began <S%G757><s%> to accuse <S%G2723><s%> Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "We found <S%G2147><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> misleading <S%G1294><s%> our nation <S%G1484><s%> and forbidding <S%G2967><s%> to pay <S%G1325><s%> taxes <S%G5411><s%> to Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> and saying <S%G3004><s%> that He Himself <S%G1438><s%> is Christ, <S%G5547><s%> a King. <S%G935><s%>"

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> asked <S%G2065><s%> Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Are You the King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%>?" And He answered <S%G611><s%> him and said, <S%G5346><s%> "[It is as] you say. <S%G3004><s%>"

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the multitudes, <S%G3793><s%> "I find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> guilt <S%G159><s%> in this <S%G3778><s%> man. <S%G444><s%>"

But they kept on insisting, <S%G2001><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "He stirs <S%G383><s%> up the people, <S%G2992><s%> teaching <S%G1321><s%> all <S%G3650><s%> over <S%G2596><s%> Judea, <S%G2453><s%> starting <S%G757><s%> from Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> even as far <S%G2193><s%> as this <S%G5602><s%> place. <S%G5602><s%>"
But when Pilate <S%G4091><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> it, he asked <S%G1905><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> the man <S%G444><s%> was a Galilean. <S%G1057><s%>

And when he learned <S%G1921><s%> that He belonged <S%G1510><s%> <S%G1537><s%> to Herod <S%G2264><s%>'s jurisdiction, <S%G1849><s%> he sent <S%G375><s%> Him to Herod, who himself <S%G846><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> was in Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> at that time. <S%G2250><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> was very <S%G3029><s%> glad <S%G5463><s%> when he saw <S%G3708><s%> Jesus; <S%G2424><s%> for he had <S%G1510><s%> wanted <S%G2309><s%> to see <S%G3708><s%> Him for a long <S%G2425><s%> time, <S%G5550><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> he had been hearing <S%G191><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> Him and was hoping <S%G1679><s%> to see <S%G3708><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> sign <S%G4592><s%> performed <S%G1096><s%> by Him.
And he questioned <S%G1905><s%> Him at some <S%G2425><s%> length <S%G3056><s%>; <S%G2425><s%> but He answered <S%G611><s%> him nothing. <S%G3762><s%>
And the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the scribes <S%G1122><s%> were standing <S%G2476><s%> there, accusing <S%G2723><s%> Him vehemently. <S%G2159><s%>

And Herod <S%G2264><s%> with his soldiers, <S%G4753><s%> after treating <S%G1848><s%> Him with contempt <S%G1848><s%> and mocking <S%G1702><s%> Him, dressed <S%G4016><s%> Him in a gorgeous <S%G2986><s%> robe <S%G2066><s%> and sent <S%G375><s%> Him back <S%G375><s%> to Pilate. <S%G4091><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%> and Pilate <S%G4091><s%> became <S%G1096><s%> friends <S%G5384><s%> with one <S%G240><s%> another <S%G240><s%> that very <S%G846><s%> day; <S%G2250><s%> for before <S%G4391><s%> they had been <S%G4391><s%> <S%G1510><s%> at enmity <S%G2189><s%> with each <S%G848><s%> other. <S%G848><s%>
And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> summoned <S%G4779><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the rulers <S%G758><s%> and the people, <S%G2992><s%>

and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "You brought <S%G4374><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to me as one who incites <S%G654><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%> to rebellion, <S%G654><s%> and behold, <S%G2400><s%> having examined <S%G350><s%> Him before <S%G1799><s%> you, I have found <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> guilt <S%G159><s%> in this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> regarding the charges <S%G2723><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> you make <S%G2723><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Him.

"No, <S%G235><s%> nor <S%G3761><s%> has Herod, <S%G2264><s%> for he sent <S%G375><s%> Him back <S%G375><s%> to us; and behold, <S%G2400><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> deserving <S%G514><s%> death <S%G2288><s%> has been <S%G1510><s%> done <S%G4238><s%> by Him.
"I will therefore <S%G3767><s%> punish <S%G3811><s%> Him and release <S%G630><s%> Him."
[Now <S%G1161><s%> he was obliged <S%G2192><s%> <S%G318><s%> to release <S%G630><s%> to them at the feast <S%G1859><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> prisoner.]

But they cried <S%G349><s%> out all <S%G3826><s%> together, <S%G3826><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Away <S%G142><s%> with this <S%G3778><s%> man, <S%G3778><s%> and release <S%G630><s%> for us Barabbas! <S%G912><s%>"

(He was one <S%G3748><s%> who <S%G3748><s%> had been thrown <S%G906><s%> into prison <S%G5438><s%> for a certain <S%G5100><s%> insurrection <S%G4714><s%> made <S%G1096><s%> in the city, <S%G4172><s%> and for murder. <S%G5408><s%>)
And Pilate, <S%G4091><s%> wanting <S%G2309><s%> to release <S%G630><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> addressed <S%G4377><s%> them again, <S%G3825><s%>
but they kept on calling <S%G2019><s%> out, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Crucify, <S%G4717><s%> crucify <S%G4717><s%> Him!"

And he said <S%G3004><s%> to them the third <S%G5154><s%> time, <S%G5154><s%> "Why, <S%G1063><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> has this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> done <S%G4160><s%>? I have found <S%G2147><s%> in Him no <S%G3762><s%> guilt <S%G159><s%> [demanding] death; <S%G2288><s%> I will therefore <S%G3767><s%> punish <S%G3811><s%> Him and release <S%G630><s%> Him."

But they were insistent, <S%G1945><s%> with loud <S%G3173><s%> voices <S%G5456><s%> asking <S%G154><s%> that He be crucified. <S%G4717><s%> And their voices <S%G5456><s%> [began] to prevail. <S%G2729><s%>
And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> pronounced <S%G1948><s%> sentence <S%G1948><s%> that their demand <S%G155><s%> should be granted. <S%G1096><s%>

And he released <S%G630><s%> the man they were asking <S%G154><s%> for who had been thrown <S%G906><s%> into prison <S%G5438><s%> for insurrection <S%G4714><s%> and murder, <S%G5408><s%> but he delivered <S%G3860><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> to their will. <S%G2307><s%>

And when <S%G5613><s%> they led <S%G520><s%> Him away, <S%G520><s%> they laid <S%G1949><s%> hold <S%G1949><s%> of one <S%G5100><s%> Simon <S%G4613><s%> of Cyrene, <S%G2956><s%> coming <S%G2064><s%> in from the country, <S%G68><s%> and placed <S%G2007><s%> on him the cross <S%G4716><s%> to carry <S%G5342><s%> behind <S%G3693><s%> Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

And there were following <S%G190><s%> Him a great <S%G4183><s%> multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the people, <S%G2992><s%> and of women <S%G1135><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> were mourning <S%G2875><s%> and lamenting <S%G2354><s%> Him.

But Jesus <S%G2424><s%> turning <S%G4762><s%> to them said, <S%G3004><s%> "Daughters <S%G2364><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> stop <S%G3361><s%> weeping <S%G2799><s%> for Me, but weep <S%G2799><s%> for yourselves <S%G1438><s%> and for your children. <S%G5043><s%>

"For behold, <S%G2400><s%> the days <S%G2250><s%> are coming <S%G2064><s%> when <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3739><s%> they will say, <S%G3004><s%> 'Blessed <S%G3107><s%> are the barren, <S%G4723><s%> and the wombs <S%G2836><s%> that never <S%G3756><s%> bore, <S%G1080><s%> and the breasts <S%G3149><s%> that never <S%G3756><s%> nursed. <S%G5142><s%>'
"Then <S%G5119><s%> they will begin <S%G757><s%> to say <S%G3004><s%> to the mountains, <S%G3735><s%> 'Fall <S%G4098><s%> on us,' and to the hills, <S%G1015><s%> 'Cover <S%G2572><s%> us.'

" For if <S%G1487><s%> they do <S%G4160><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> in the green <S%G5200><s%> tree, <S%G3586><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> will happen <S%G1096><s%> in the dry <S%G3584><s%>?"
And two <S%G1417><s%> others <S%G2087><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> who were criminals, <S%G2557><s%> were being led <S%G71><s%> away <S%G71><s%> to be put <S%G337><s%> to death <S%G337><s%> with Him.

And when <S%G3753><s%> they came <S%G2064><s%> to the place <S%G5117><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> The Skull, <S%G2898><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> they crucified <S%G4717><s%> Him and the criminals, <S%G2557><s%> one <S%G3739><s%> on the right <S%G1188><s%> and the other <S%G3739><s%> on the left. <S%G710><s%>

But Jesus <S%G2424><s%> was saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Father, <S%G3962><s%> forgive <S%G863><s%> them; for they do not know <S%G3609><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> they are doing. <S%G4160><s%>" And they cast <S%G906><s%> lots, <S%G2819><s%> dividing <S%G1266><s%> up His garments <S%G2440><s%> among <S%G1266><s%> themselves.

And the people <S%G2992><s%> stood <S%G2476><s%> by, looking <S%G2334><s%> on. And even <S%G2532><s%> the rulers <S%G758><s%> were sneering <S%G1592><s%> at Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "He saved <S%G4982><s%> others; <S%G243><s%> let Him save <S%G4982><s%> Himself <S%G1438><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> is the Christ <S%G5547><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> His Chosen <S%G1588><s%> One. <S%G1588><s%>"
And the soldiers <S%G4757><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> mocked <S%G1702><s%> Him, coming <S%G4334><s%> up to Him, offering <S%G4374><s%> Him sour <S%G3690><s%> wine, <S%G3690><s%>
and saying, <S%G3004><s%> "If <S%G1487><s%> You are the King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> save <S%G4982><s%> Yourself! <S%G4572><s%>"
Now <S%G1161><s%> there was also <S%G2532><s%> an inscription <S%G1923><s%> above <S%G1909><s%> Him, "THIS <S%G3778><s%> IS THE KING <S%G935><s%> OF THE JEWS. <S%G2453><s%>"

And one <S%G1520><s%> of the criminals <S%G2557><s%> who were hanged <S%G2910><s%> [there] was hurling <S%G987><s%> abuse <S%G987><s%> at Him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Are You not the Christ <S%G5547><s%>? Save <S%G4982><s%> Yourself <S%G4572><s%> and us!"

But the other <S%G2087><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> and rebuking <S%G2008><s%> him said, <S%G5346><s%> "Do you not even <S%G3761><s%> fear <S%G5399><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> since <S%G3754><s%> you are under <S%G1722><s%> the same <S%G846><s%> sentence <S%G2917><s%> of condemnation <S%G2917><s%>?

"And we indeed <S%G3303><s%> justly, <S%G1346><s%> for we are receiving <S%G618><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> we deserve <S%G514><s%> for our deeds <S%G3739><s%>; <S%G4238><s%> but this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> has done <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> wrong. <S%G824><s%>"
And he was saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> remember <S%G3403><s%> me when <S%G3752><s%> You come <S%G2064><s%> in Your kingdom! <S%G932><s%>"
And He said <S%G3004><s%> to him, "Truly <S%G281><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%> to you, today <S%G4594><s%> you shall be with Me in Paradise. <S%G3857><s%>"

And it was now <S%G2235><s%> about <S%G5616><s%> the sixth <S%G1623><s%> hour, <S%G5610><s%> and darkness <S%G4655><s%> fell <S%G1096><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> the whole <S%G3650><s%> land <S%G1093><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> the ninth <S%G7067><s%> hour, <S%G5610><s%>
the sun <S%G2246><s%> being obscured; <S%G1587><s%> and the veil <S%G2665><s%> of the temple <S%G3485><s%> was torn <S%G4977><s%> in two. <S%G3319><s%>

And Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> crying <S%G5455><s%> out with a loud <S%G3173><s%> voice, <S%G5456><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> "Father, <S%G3962><s%> into Thy hands <S%G5495><s%> I commit <S%G3908><s%> My spirit. <S%G4151><s%>" And having said <S%G3004><s%> this, <S%G3778><s%> He breathed <S%G1606><s%> His last. <S%G1606><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> when the centurion <S%G1543><s%> saw <S%G3708><s%> what had happened, <S%G1096><s%> he [began] praising <S%G1392><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Certainly <S%G3689><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> was innocent. <S%G1342><s%>"

And all <S%G3956><s%> the multitudes <S%G3793><s%> who came <S%G4836><s%> together <S%G4836><s%> for this <S%G3778><s%> spectacle, <S%G2335><s%> when they observed <S%G2334><s%> what had happened, <S%G1096><s%> [began] to return, <S%G5290><s%> beating <S%G5180><s%> their breasts. <S%G4738><s%>

And all <S%G3956><s%> His acquaintances <S%G1110><s%> and the women <S%G1135><s%> who accompanied <S%G4870><s%> Him from Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> were standing <S%G2476><s%> at a distance, <S%G3113><s%> seeing <S%G3708><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things. <S%G3778><s%>

And behold, <S%G2400><s%> a man <S%G435><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Joseph, <S%G2501><s%> who was a member <S%G1010><s%> of the Council, <S%G1010><s%> a good <S%G18><s%> and righteous <S%G1342><s%> man <S%G435><s%>

(he had not consented <S%G4784><s%> to their plan <S%G1012><s%> and action <S%G4234><s%>), [a man] from Arimathea, <S%G707><s%> a city <S%G4172><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> was waiting <S%G4327><s%> for the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God; <S%G2316><s%>
this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> went <S%G4334><s%> to Pilate <S%G4091><s%> and asked <S%G154><s%> for the body <S%G4983><s%> of Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

And he took <S%G2507><s%> it down <S%G2507><s%> and wrapped <S%G1794><s%> it in a linen <S%G4616><s%> cloth, <S%G4616><s%> and laid <S%G5087><s%> Him in a tomb <S%G3418><s%> cut <S%G2991><s%> into the rock, <S%G2991><s%> where <S%G3757><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> had ever <S%G3768><s%> lain. <S%G2749><s%>
And it was the preparation <S%G3904><s%> day, <S%G2250><s%> and the Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> was about <S%G2020><s%> to begin. <S%G2020><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> the women <S%G1135><s%> who <S%G3748><s%> had come <S%G4905><s%> with Him out of Galilee <S%G1056><s%> followed <S%G2628><s%> after, <S%G2628><s%> and saw <S%G2300><s%> the tomb <S%G3419><s%> and how <S%G5613><s%> His body <S%G4983><s%> was laid. <S%G5087><s%>

And they returned <S%G5290><s%> and prepared <S%G2090><s%> spices <S%G759><s%> and perfumes. <S%G3464><s%> And on the Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> they rested <S%G2270><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the commandment. <S%G1785><s%>
